answers.answer: Hi!I'm so sorry that you lost your little girl.  Those tiny tiny babies are so precious!Pre eclampsia is more common in the first pregnancy than in subsequent pregnancies.  So, you have that going for you.  Your risk of recurrence is pretty high though, given that in your case the pre-eclampsia was probably due to your kidney disease.A couple of thoughts.  I agree with their use of Clexane, and I certainly hope they continued it for 6 weeks post partum.  If you could tolerate it, you might consider taking a baby aspirin daily during a new pregnancy.  Because both medications are "blood thinners" you might not be able to tolerate them without bleeding, but some studies have shown a reduction in the risk of  recurrent pre-eclampsia with daily aspirin (81mg).Also, there is some pretty good literature suggesting that controlling blood pressures with medications is safe(as opposed to delivery) in certain cases of pre-eclampsia when the baby is very early. (I don't know the details of your case). If you could even get 4 weeks further along, you would very likely take home a baby!Another thing to consider, if it hasn't been done, is a work up for antiphospholipid antibodies.  If you are positive for one or several conditions, your risk would be higher than if you were negative.I hope some of this is helpful!Good luck!Dr B

question: I am 34 years old with 1 functional kidney.  I lost function im my right kidney 7 years ago due to a blood clot (renal vein thrombosis) but it has atrophied and remains inside of me.  I became pregnant in October 2008 and the decision after conferring with a Nephrologist. Haematologist and my Obstetrician was to manage the pregnancy using daily Clexane injections (40mg).  I have always been normal tensive (110/70 or 120/80).  In mid April 2009 at 26.5 weeks my blood pressure went up and I was diagnosed with pre-eclampsia......prior to this I was having a normal pregnancy.  I was given steroids to open up the baby's lungs and I was delivered at 28 weeks by emergency c section.  My baby girl weighed 700 grams (1.5lbs) and had an APGAR score of 7 at birth and a score 8 five minutes after.  After 3 weeks my little girl weighed 860grams however she developed complications and passed away after 28 days although she will live forever in my heart.  The only supplements I was on during the pregnancy were folic acid and ferrous sulphate.My obsterician has noted that I had developed severe PET and Nephrotic Syndrome in this pregnancy.  I am now normal tensive and my blood tests have indicated that my renal function is back to normal.  I am considering another pregnancy but I am worried that a repeat scenario may be possible.  What advice can you give me?
title: PreEclampsia and Nephrotic Syndrome in a 2nd Pregnancy
